content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to clean a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # lowercase it
    col = lowercase(col)
    # strip any leading or trailing whitespaces
    col = lstrip(rstrip(col))
    # replace spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    return col
end
```

You can use this function like this:

```julia
column_name = clean_column("My Column")
println(column_name)  # Outputs: "my_column"
```
